cleaning_steps.reason: Duplicate log entries would inflate error counts and skew statistical analysis. Keeping first occurrence only.

cleaning_steps.description: Standardized severity levels (12 variations to 4 standard levels)
cleaning_steps.reason: Inconsistent severity labels prevent accurate grouping and priority analysis. P1/CRITICAL/Critical all mean the same thing.

cleaning_steps.description: Standardized environment names (9 variations to 3 standard names)
cleaning_steps.reason: Environment filtering is critical for isolating production issues from dev/staging. Inconsistent names prevent this analysis.
Multiple timestamp formats prevent time-series analysis and sorting. Unified format enables trend detection.

cleaning_steps.description: Cleaned response_time_ms: removed values outside 1-10000ms range
cleaning_steps.reason: Negative values (-1) indicate logging errors. Zero values are impossible for real requests. Values >10000ms suggest timeouts, not actual response times.
INVALID_IP is a system placeholder, not a real address. 0.0.0.0 is non-routable. Both would corrupt network analysis.

cleaning_steps.description: Standardized user IDs to USR-XXXX format
cleaning_steps.reason: Mixed ID formats prevent user-level analysis. UNKNOWN provides no useful information and is treated as missing.
Dropping rows with missing categories would lose valuable timing and error data. Filling with 'Unknown' preserves records while flagging incomplete data.
